item.title: Offsite Backup Providers
item.description: Offsite Backup Providers After some research I have made my choice for the provider I’ll use for my off-site backups. iDrive e2 Reasons why I went for iDrive e2: Compatible with Restic and Synology Cheap 2FA S3 object storage 5 TB $247.50/year $123.75 first year 10 TB $495.00/year $247.50 first year 20 TB $990.00/year $495.00 first year www.idrive.com/s3-storage-e2/ Hetzner Storage Box Looks good, but the data is attached to one server only as far as I can gather.

item.title: The importance of cleanliness
item.description: I have some good routines around keeping my apartment clean and clutter free. I try to mop my floors every week, clean my office every Monday, and I always do my dishes right after I’m done with my food preparations.

item.title: Home
item.description: Welcome. I’ve been keeping a Zettelkasten for about 3 years now, and I’ve accumulated nearly 2500 notes. And I enjoy reading other people’s Zettelkasten too, such as rwxrob’s.

item.title: Johnny uses a lot of subfolders and sub-ids too
item.description: Johnny uses a lot of subfolders and sub-ids too I like the concept of creating ID’s like 31.12.001 for things. One use case is repos Storing Repos in Johnny Decimal system for example.

item.title: Knowing Containers, Databases & Code is Magic
item.description: Knowing Containers, Databases & Code is Magic Forget making money. If you learn to write Python code, work with containers, and how to store data in databases, there are so many interesting things you can build to enhance your life.

item.title: Storing Repos in Johnny Decimal system
item.description: Storing Repos in Johnny Decimal system The repo should be assigned an ID from the index. It does not need to be added to the directory name of the repo.
